page.title: 19BRIGHTLINGSEA
page.content: { {THE RIVER COLNE}rises in the boulder_clay hills of north west Essex, and flows in a general south easterly direction to reach the sea, together with its neighbour, the Blackwater to the south of Brightlingsea.{The channel}is well buoyed upstream as far as Wivenhoe, being used regularly by small coasting vessels and a few fishing craft.{Bateman's Tower},lit by an orange sodium flare at night,is an important navigational marker. {The Pyefleet Channel}is an important oyster preserve and provides excellent anchorage and protection for small craft.These must take great care not to anchor above the oyster layings. {The Tidal Range at Brightlingsea Mean Spring Range 4.4 metres Mean Neap Range 2.6 metres
